etymologies: Middle English: from Old French signe (noun), signer (verb), from Latin signum ‘mark, token’

definitions: an object, quality, or event whose presence or occurrence indicates the probable presence or occurrence of something else

examples.text: flowers are often given as a sign of affection
the stores are full, which is a sign that the recession is past its worst
the signs are that counterfeiting is growing at an alarming rate

shortDefinitions: object or event whose presence indicates presence of something else

definitions: used to indicate that someone or something is not present where they should be or are expected to be

examples.text: there was still no sign of her

shortDefinitions: used to indicate that person or thing is not where they should be

definitions: an indication of a disease detectable by a medical practitioner even if not apparent to the patient

examples.text: clinical signs of liver disease

shortDefinitions: indication of disease detectable by medical practitioner even if not apparent to patient

definitions: a miracle regarded as evidence of supernatural power (chiefly in biblical and literary use)

examples.text: he observed signs and miracles taking place

shortDefinitions: miracle regarded as evidence of supernatural power

definitions: any trace of a wild animal, especially its tracks or droppings

examples.text: wolverine sign

shortDefinitions: trail of wild animal

definitions: a gesture or action used to convey information or instructions

examples.text: she gave him the thumbs-up sign

shortDefinitions: gesture or action used to convey information or instruction

definitions: an action or reaction that conveys something about someone's state or experiences

examples.text: she gave no sign of having seen him

shortDefinitions: action or reaction that conveys something about someone

definitions: a gesture used in a system of sign language.
shortDefinitions: gesture used in system of sign language

definitions: a symbol or word used to represent an operation, instruction, concept, or object in algebra, music, or other subjects

examples.text: the integral sign ∫

shortDefinitions: symbol or word used to represent operation, instruction, concept

definitions: a word or gesture given according to prior arrangement as a means of identification; a password.
shortDefinitions: word or gesture given according to prior arrangement as means of identification

definitions: a notice that is publicly displayed giving information or instructions in a written or symbolic form

examples.text: I didn't see the stop sign

shortDefinitions: notice on public display that gives information or instructions in written or symbolic form

definitions: each of the twelve equal sections into which the zodiac is divided, named from the constellations formerly situated in each, and associated with successive periods of the year according to the position of the sun on the ecliptic

examples.text: a person born under the sign of Virgo

shortDefinitions: each of twelve equal sections into which zodiac is divided

definitions: the positiveness or negativeness of a quantity

examples.text: the last four bits hold a pattern to represent the sign of the number

shortDefinitions: positiveness or negativeness of quantity

definitions: write one's name on (a letter, card, or similar item) to identify oneself as the writer or sender

examples.text: the card was signed by the whole class

shortDefinitions: write one's name on (letter, card, document, etc.) to identify oneself as writer or sender

definitions: indicate agreement with or authorization of the contents of (a document or other written or printed material) by attaching a signature

examples.text: the two countries signed a nonaggression treaty

shortDefinitions: authorize document written or printed material by attaching signature

definitions: write (one's name) for purposes of identification or authorization

examples.text: she signed her name in the book
she signed herself Ingrid
he signed on the dotted line

shortDefinitions: write one's name for purposes of identification or authorization

definitions: engage (someone, typically a sports player or a musician) to work for one by signing a contract with them

examples.text: the company signed 30 bands

shortDefinitions: engage to work for one by signing contract with them

definitions: commit oneself to work by signing a contract

examples.text: things haven't changed since I signed in the summer
Sherman has signed for another two seasons
this is the role we all thought he 'd be playing when he signed from the New York Rangers

shortDefinitions: commit oneself to work by signing contract

definitions: use gestures to convey information or instructions

examples.text: she signed to her husband to leave the room

shortDefinitions: use gestures to convey information or instructions

definitions: communicate in sign language

examples.text: she was learning to sign

shortDefinitions: communicate in sign language

definitions: express or perform (something) in sign language

examples.text: the theater routinely puts on signed performances

shortDefinitions: express or perform something in sign language

definitions: mark or consecrate with the sign of the cross

examples.text: he signed himself with the cross

shortDefinitions: mark or consecrate with sign of cross
